help_layer_army.comment: These are used when help mode activated. They show selves when help mode is on, and use topmost callback and have high priority to ensure sit above the dimmer that is activated during help mode too!

property.name: 1.inactive
property.value: (human_list = StoredContext("CcoCustomBattleLobby").PlayerSlotList.Filter(IsHuman)) => (((human_list.Size > 1 && human_list.Any(IsReady)) || CanChangeSettings == false) && IsUsingLargeArmies == false) || CanUseLargeArmies == false

localised_text.tooltip_text: When selected, play a custom battle with up to 42 units in your army
When selected, play a custom battle with battle realism enabled. This will disable the mini-map, not allow you to pause the game and limit the distance the camera can move from your units
When selected, play a custom battle in Romance of the Three Kingdoms mode. When unselected, you will play in Records of the Three Kingdoms mode
Select the type of battle you want to fight
Select the level of development of the buildings on the map. This affects the visual type of buildings present.
Select the density of buildings on the selected map
Select the amount of destruction on the map. This allows you to start a map with the walls and buildings already damaged as if the settlment had been under siege.
Change the amount of funds available
Select the map you want to play
Select the season for the battle
Select the size of settlement you want to play
Select the time of day for the battle
Select the weather for the battle
Swap who is on the Attacking or Defending side in the battle.
Swap who is on the Attacking or Defending side in the battle.

button_upgrade_unit.comment: We listen for selection of cards with ContextSelectionPropagator to update button state based on state, and we have ContextPropagator listen for unit changes to update state as change experience. Then command grabs current selection as cant store selection as its a temp, so need to use live value

We listen for selection of cards with ContextSelectionPropagator to update button state based on state, and we have ContextPropagator listen for unit changes to update state as change experience. Then command grabs current selection as cant store selection as its a temp, so need to use live value

unit_list.comment: This callback setup looks confusing, but basically it is setup this way to make the unit list update whenever we get the CustomBattleOnUnitsChanged message, since that is on player slot basis not retinue basis.

This callback setup looks confusing, but basically it is setup this way to make the unit list update whenever we get the CustomBattleOnUnitsChanged message, since that is on player slot basis not retinue basis.

retinue_list.comment: Only creates retinues can modify so as to hide units of players on other team in mp. We have refresh_if_not_visible property to fix issue where if go into custom battle with map tab by default, it wouldnt select retinue by default cos wouldnt be created, this ensures it is!

Only creates retinues can modify so as to hide units of players on other team in mp. We have refresh_if_not_visible property to fix issue where if go into custom battle with map tab by default, it wouldnt select retinue by default cos wouldnt be created, this ensures it is!

This bit only shows when on recruitment tab

should be between first character and characters behind

Then command grabs current selection as cant store selection as its a temp, so need to use live value

interactive_element.comment: Callback redirector redirects click to parent to select retinue.
Callback redirector redirects click to parent to select retinue.

callback_with_context.context_function_id: (slot = StoredContext("CcoCustomBattlePlayerSlot")) => (DoIf(slot.CanRecruitDeployable(this) && slot.CanModifyUnits && slot.NumDeployables(this) < this.CustomBattleRecordContext.Cap && slot.NumDeployables < slot.DeployablesCap, slot.AddDeployable(this)))

(slot = StoredContext("CcoCustomBattlePlayerSlot")) => (DoIf(slot.CanRecruitDeployable(this) && slot.CanModifyUnits && slot.NumDeployables(this) < this.CustomBattleRecordContext.Cap && slot.NumDeployables < slot.DeployablesCap, slot.AddDeployable(this)))
GetIfElse(this.IsEmpty == false, ToUpper(GetIfElse(this.Size > 1, Loc("uniform_editor_custom"), this.FirstContext.Description)), ToUpper(Loc("all")))

button_tab_armies.comment: Not a template as made selected state non interactive so can stop it switching to other tab when click!

button_tab_maps.comment: Not a template as made selected state non interactive so can stop it switching to other tab when click!

player_slot_options.comment: We use a blank context visibility setter to hide initially in game, and mouseclickhidecallback to make hide when click elsewhere

callback_with_context.context_function_id: Format("%S, %S\n%S\n%d, %d", ClickgenProvinceName, ClickgenRegionName, ClickgenGroundTypeName, RoundFloat(ClickgenCoords.x), RoundFloat(ClickgenCoords.y))

recruitment_parent.comment: Parent for recruitables, stores player slot context so can be queried by recruitment items

left_side_parent.comment: Put after right_side in hierarchy so that left side will have player selected by default!

right_side_parent.comment: Put before left_side in hierarchy so that left side will have player selected by default!

side_parent.comment: This parent needs to have this name to team entries can search from this component to find army parent to initialise when select a player

selected_character_details_parent.comment: Shows details of selected retinues commanding character. If no character selected not shown. Setup to update when current selected player slots unit changes instead of any unit changing (that is why have object_store_events and various propagators and object stores, to make it just listen for selected retinues player slots units changing)

unit_info_panel_parent.comment: Creates unit info panel. Needs to be higher in hierarchy than anything that wants to access it so created before anything else created so ContextPinChild find component correctly!

autoresolve_display.componentleveltooltip: The green bar represents the power of the team on the left and the red bar represents the power of the team on the right. \n If one bar is larger than the other, it means the army with the larger bar has an advantage over the smaller one

retinue_selection_handler.comment: This component is the selection parent to handle selection of the current retinue. It lives at this top level so can have a single retinue selected across both teams! When a retinue is selected it initialises the recruitment parent with that retinue so any recruitment is performed for that retinue. Listens for CcoContextSelection so when player slot selected it will select the first retinue for that player slot (guids are the player slot list context selection parents). Note relies on player team being after enemy team in hierarchy to ensure players slot is selected by default (as created and therefore notifies us last)

team_slot_options.comment: We use a blank context visibility setter to hide initially in game, and mouseclickhidecallback to make hide when click elsewhere

unit_card.comment: ScottB: The ContextPropagator that passes own context to self for unit record is to make it refresh when change selection, in the event that the list itself isnt refreshed when changed character selection

template_unit_group.comment: element thing should be deleted from component

unit_selection_handler.comment: This component is the selection parent to handle selection of the current unit(s) for upgrading xp, etc. It lives at this top level so can have a single unit selection selected across both teams!

label_preset_not_selected.comment: Shown when a non-preset map selected on clickgen

label_preset_selected.comment: Shown when a preset map is selected, shows name of preset map

popup_waiting.comment: Shown when joining a multiplayer battle before it is ready. Has animations that does opposite you would expect (show hides) in order to invert functionality

ready_parent.comment: Shown once screen ready, which is immediately in sp but there is a delay in joining game where dont want to show placeholder info which is why we hide it until then

template_character_group.comment: element thing should be deleted from component

label_large_armies.componentleveltooltip: When selected, play a custom battle with up to 42 units in your army

label_realism_mode.componentleveltooltip: When selected, play a custom battle with battle realism enabled. This will disable the mini-map, not allow you to pause the game and limit the distance the camera can move from your units

label_romance_mode.componentleveltooltip: When selected, play a custom battle in Romance of the Three Kingdoms mode. When unselected, you will play in Records of the Three Kingdoms mode

help_layer_battle_options.comment: These are used when help mode activated. They show selves when help mode is on, and use topmost callback and have high priority to ensure sit above the dimmer that is activated during help mode too!

popup_downloading.comment: Shown when joining a multiplayer battle before it is ready. Has animations that does opposite you would expect (show hides) in order to invert functionality

locked_character_holder.comment: Hennadii: resize target is template_character. so tooltip from this component can block tooltip from template_character, which has dynamic height
